p: One study estimated chikungunya transmission risk according to temperature threshold for breeding and adult mosquitoes in Argentina [ 99]. The authors suggest that temperatures conducive to Ae. aegypti breeding and transmission are present during September and April in northeastern Argentina, and in January in southern Argentina. A study compared endemic and transient chikungunya and dengue transmission dynamics, and the role of virus evolution [ 100]. They found that reducing biting rate and vector-to-susceptible-host ratio were the most effective at reducing basic reproductive number. A study modelled transmission risk of Zika, dengue and chikungunya and found temperature data to match well with human case data [ 73].
